title: 103_s757
content: The Act titled "Pipe and Tube Inverted Tariff Correction Act of 1993" addresses nonalloy iron and steel pipes and tubes. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to change the description and redesignate certain subheadings for iron and steel pipes and tubes. Duty rates for specific subheadings are also adjusted. The Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States is amended to change duty rates for iron and steel pipes and tubes. New subheadings are added with adjusted rates of duty. SEC. 3. ALLOY IRON AND STEEL PIPES AND TUBES: Subheadings 7306.50.50 and 7306.90.50 amended to increase duty rates. SEC. 4. STAINLESS STEEL PIPES AND TUBES. SEC. 4. STAINLESS STEEL PIPES AND TUBES: Amendments to duty rates for stainless steel pipes and tubes. SEC. 6. APPLICABILITY OF STAGED RATE REDUCTIONS UNDER THE UNITED STATES-CANADA FREE-TRADE AGREEMENT. Any staged reduction of special duty rates under the United States-Canada Free-Trade Agreement applies to corresponding rates in the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States. The special duty rates under the United States-Canada Free-Trade Agreement also apply to the specific duty rate in subheading 7306.30.60 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by sections 2, 3, and 4 shall apply with respect to goods entered on the date of a multilateral trade agreement or January 1, 1994. SEC. 8. WAIVER. SEC. 8. WAIVER. The Act will not apply if negotiations in the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade result in a tariff elimination schedule for steel products that removes tariff inversion on certain pipe and tube products, and the President certifies in writing to the Committee on Ways and Means and the Committee on Finance that the schedule will eliminate the tariff inversion.
